snippet: Prosecutors said the operators of the scheme bilked thousands of Americans by posing as authority figures demanding payments for bogus debts....
abstract: Federal prosecutors bring charges against dozens accused of participation in international crime ring involving Indian call centers from which they posed as tax collectors, American customs agents and other authority figures; ring took in over $300 million by threatening arrest or deportation if bogus debts were not paid; Justice Dept officials will seek to have Indian authorities extradite defendants to United States to stand trial on fraud, money laundering and other charges.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors said the operators of the scheme bilked thousands of Americans by posing as authority figures demanding payments for bogus debts.

headline.main: U.S. Indicts Dozens in $300 Million Indian Call Center Scheme
headline.print_headline: U.S. Indicts Dozens in Indian Call Center Scheme
